qas.question: During his search for enlightenment, Gautama combined what teachings?

answers.text: the yoga practice of his teacher Kalama with what later became known as "the immeasurables"

qas.question: What was the new kind of human invented by Gautama?
What are the Four Immeasurable Minds also known as?

answers.text: brahmaviharas, divine abodes, or simply as four immeasurables

qas.question: What is the best known of the four immeasurables?
The Four Immeasurables are taught as a form of meditation that cultivates what?

answers.text: wholesome attitudes towards all sentient beings

qas.question: Gautama combined the yoga practice of what teacher?
Gautama invented a new kind of human without what?
Who calls the four immeasurable minds "four limitless ones"?
The Four Immeasurables are taught as a form of what?

context: While he searched for enlightenment, Gautama combined <a0_0>the yoga practice of his teacher <a5_0>Kalama<a5_0/> with what later became known as "the immeasurables"<a0_0/>.[dubious – discuss] Gautama thus invented a new kind of human, <a1_0>one without <a6_0>egotism<a6_0/><a1_0/>.[dubious – discuss] What Thich Nhat Hanh calls the "Four Immeasurable Minds" of <a7_0>love, compassion, joy, and equanimity<a7_0/>[full citation needed] are also known as <a2_0>brahmaviharas, divine abodes, or simply as four immeasurables<a2_0/>.[web 5] <a8_0>Pema Chödrön<a8_0/> calls them the "four limitless ones". Of the four, <a3_0>mettā or loving-kindness <a9_0>meditation<a9_0/><a3_0/> is perhaps the best known.[web 5] The Four Immeasurables are taught as a form of meditation that cultivates "<a4_0>wholesome attitudes towards all sentient beings<a4_0/>."[web 6][web 7]
